title: Electric PE - U when top 2 spheres in square move

content.prompt: Four small, charged spheres are initially fixed in place at the corners of a square of side length s, as shown in the figure labeled “Initial Configuration.” The charges on the spheres are as indicated. Then the top two spheres are each moved a distance s to the right, as shown in the figure labeled “Final Configuration.” What happens to the electric potential energy U of the four-sphere system when the top two spheres are moved to the final configuration, and what evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: U becomes higher. Moving charge of the same sign closer together and charge of the opposite sign farther apart results in a higher potential energy.
U becomes higher. The magnitude of the attractive force between the two spheres with the greatest charge magnitude increases.
U becomes lower. Moving positively charged spheres farther away from a negatively charged sphere means that negative work is done by external forces.
U becomes lower. The maximum separation between two spheres in the system has increased, and electric potential energy is inversely proportional to separation distance.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
